questions.question: Where was the first programmer from ?
questions.description: Augusta Ada King, Countess of Lovelace (Born Byron, 1815 – 1852) was an English mathematician and writer, often considered to be the first computer programmer.

questions.question: Who created the first automated computers ?
questions.description: This common dream we had since the premises of humanity, to correct our own errors led many brilliant inventors to create the first automated computers. The first of them was Charles Babbage.

questions.question: Where did we invented mathematics ?
questions.description: As one of the greatest empire the world has never met, Ancient Egypt, confronted to different problems such as measuring and calculating areas of lands, gave birth to the earliest mathematical inovators.

questions.question: What was the first objects we used to count in the ancient Sumerian civilization ?
questions.description: Before the modern age and the worldwide spread of knowledge, 6 000 years ago, people of Sumer, the first world’s civilization, turned 1 into a cone-shaped token, and by the same way started counting.

questions.question: Where was the philosphy that inspired the invetion of Binary from ?
questions.description: Based on the taoist traditionnal philosophy, the Chinese conception of the universe that it is based on Yin and Yang ("something" and "the gap") traveled around the world and led the German mathematician Gottfried Wilhelm Leibniz to use it as a new counting system : the binary.

questions.question: Who was considered as one of the "fathers of the Internet" ?
questions.description: Vint Cerf (1943) is an American engineer and co-inventor of TCP/IP protocole with Bob Kahn. He is recognized as one of the "fathers of the Internet".

questions.question: Where did we created Arpanet, the ancestor of the Internet ?
questions.description: The Advanced Research Projects Agency Network (ARPANET) was an early packet-switching network and the first network to implement the TCP/IP protocol suite. Both technologies became the technical foundation of the Internet. The ARPANET was initially founded by the Advanced Research Projects Agency (ARPA) of the United States Department of Defense.

questions.question: Which numeral system is used by computers ?
questions.description: Everything that a computer does comes down to what’s known as MicroTransistors, tiny switches that can either be on, or off. Thus, we represent “on” by 1, and “off” by 0.

questions.question: In which country the government released funds to allow us invent the first computer ?
questions.description: Since the greatest beneficiaries of the first computer would be the British government and people, in 1823, the treasury provided a grant for the project.

questions.question: Who worked with Charles Babbage on the Analytical Engine ?
questions.description: When Augusta Ada King Kin was a teenager, her mathematical talents led her to a long working relationship and friendship with the fellow British mathematician Charles Babbage.
